documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenStack Platform 16.1.4 (python-django) security update

note.text:
An update for python-django is now available for Red Hat OpenStack Platform
16.1 (Train).

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Django is a high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid
development and a clean, pragmatic design. It focuses on automating as much
as possible and adhering to the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle.

Security Fix(es):

* potential data leakage via malformed memcached keys (CVE-2020-13254)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE
page listed in the References section.

description.text:

described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
